content.description: Nearly perfect holds and movement for the entire route.  Begin on the the solid chunk corner with bad gear for the first 10 feet.  Trend left around a pillar type feature to amazing holds and gear.  Once at the top of the pillar take a shake, place some gear and make the runout to the anchors.  Fall should be safe.  Save some small/medium gear for the top (.3 - .5)
content.protection: standard rack, save some medium/small pieces for the top.
content.location: Walk up and left the sand/choss slab under the big over hang.  This climb begins on the corner where the wall gets vertical.

content.description: First Route Right of Fred Sauceman.  Climb up to a pinched off crack feature with just enough holds.  Then move through easier ground trending left.
content.location: First Route Right of Fred Sauceman.

content.description: This line follows the narrowish dihedral left of "Fred Sauceman" crack.  Work your way up the diherdal and then trend left through a thin looking crack to the anchors.
content.protection: Standard rack.  Takes a solid #3 Cammalot to protect the opening

content.description: Follow the obvious crack just right of the dihedral.  Follow the crack through good holds and relaxed stances.  Clip anchors out right of the crack
content.protection: Standard rack of mid-sized gear.  Takes good gear all the way up.

content.description: Same start as fake news, but as the crack trends left follow the two bolts right over the beautiful hard stone through a crux leading to better holds up top.
content.protection: Gear + 2 Bolts, Small Nuts or BD 0 and 00 to protect the opening crack feature.

content.description: Great Committing Route.  Begin just right of the corner and just left of the big steep overhang.  Traverse right unprotected until you're into the corner beneath the obvious seam.  Sketchy small gear protects the seam with a committing move to better holds.  Climb trending left to the top of the detached pillar feature.  Move right a bit onto the face with good holds and sneaky gear (.3-.5).
content.protection: Standard Rack+ small nuts or BD 0 and 00 to protect initial crack.
content.location: walk up and left from the sand/choss under the enormous roof.  Route begins just before going around the corner.

content.description: Begin on the same start as Christmas in The Trenches.  The start is a v2 ish boulder problem and definitely the hardest part of the route.  Once established this route is an amazing 5.10 that breaks left to the arete at the 3rd bolt of Christmas in the Trenches.  This route has some of the coolest holts in the entire gorge.
content.location: Arete 100 yards past the mile two marker

content.description: Beautiful arete beginning with the mini dihedral feature.
content.location: 50 yards past mile two marker where the wall cuts back away from the main trail a bit.

content.description: Begins on flake feature leading up to an awesome powerful and sequential crux.
content.location: Just up from Christmas in the trenches

content.description: This area gets morning shade and is mainly easy to moderate routes.
